timeline.author: albertshau

timeline.bodyText:
can you add a test for if the generated field comes from the sink? More specifically, something like:
read a, b -> write a, b, c
This can happen if the sink always adds additional data. For example, something can write an additional 'updated_time' field or something like that.
timeline.author: albertshau

replies.bodyText:
This kind of operation cannot be defined like this, if you like at the contract of WriteOperation: https://github.com/cdapio/cdap/blob/develop/cdap-api/src/main/java/io/cdap/cdap/api/lineage/field/WriteOperation.java#L40, the write operation can only take a list of input fields, so in order to generate c. The above operation will must look something like:
read [a,b],
transform [] -> [c],
write [read.a, read.b, transform.c]
This kind of scenario is already added in this unit test.
replies.author: yaojiefeng

replies.bodyText: To be more clear, if a sink adds a column, then that sink will need to emit that generate transform, and then add the write operation.
replies.author: yaojiefeng
